page.title: 19Woodcarvers of Crayke
page.content: Woodcarers of Crayke was started in 1967. For the first six years it was situated in Mr Oliver Banks disused Bakery. Then a new workshop was built down Stillington Raod. The company has exported furniture to Japan, Australia, America, Africa and most of Europe. Important jobs have been a staircase for an Arab Sheik, tables for Windsor Castle and a chair for the Queen and boardroom furniture for GEC. All the work is in English Oak and at present time there is a work force of four people. The furniture is sold directly to the public from the showrooms that are built adjacent to the workshops.
